column1: Should the Government to stop the planned badger cull and implement the more sustainable and humane solution of both a vaccination programme for badgers and cattle, along with improved testing and biosecurity?
column2: Business of the House - Badger Cull

column1: Should parents be allowed to use reasonable force or chastisement when exercising authority over their children?
Should the Government accept a Lords amendment to abolish the common law offences of blasphemy and blasphemous libel?
column2: Criminal Justice and Immigration Bill: Blasphemy

column1: Should the Government remove the section in the Local Government Act 1986 that says: A local authority shall not intentionally promote homosexuality or publish material with the intention of promoting homosexuality; or promote the teaching in any maintained school of the acceptability of homosexuality as a pretended family relationship?
column2: Local Government Bill - Repeal of prohibition on promotion of homosexuality (Section 28)

column1: Should the Government to legislate to lower the voting age for all public elections to 16 years?
Should the Government raise the UK's undergraduate tuition fee cap to 9,000 per year?
column2: University Tuition Fee Cap - Raise Upper Limit to 9,000 Per Year

column1: Should we continue to deploy of UK armed forces in Afghanistan?
column2: UK Armed Forces in Afghanistan (Backbench Business)

column1: Should Value Added Tax be increased from 17.5 to 20?
column2: Finance Bill - Increase in Rate of Value Added Tax

column1: Should any sanctions proposed by the EU in relation to economic governance not apply to the UK?
Should the Government prepare for and permit Royal Mail privatisation?
Should the maximum period of detention without charge for terrorist suspects be kept at 28 days?
